{{also|gegen-}} ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{der|de|gmh|gegen}}, from {{der|de|goh|gagan}}, from {{der|de|gem-pro|*gagin}}. Cognate with {{cog|nl|tegen}}, {{cog|en|against}}, {{cog|is|gegn}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈɡe.ɡən/|[ˈɡeː.ɡn̩]|[ˈɡeː.ɡŋ̍]}} * {{audio|de|De-gegen.ogg|audio}} ===Preposition=== {{head|de|preposition}} {{tlb|de|+ accusative}} # [[against]] #: {{ux|de|Der Erklärung der Vereinten Nationen über die Beseitigung der Gewalt '''gegen''' Frauen.|The United Nations Declaration on the Elimination of Violence '''against''' Women.}} ====Usage notes==== * Like its Middle High German predecessor, ''gegen'' was formerly also used with the dative, especially by [[Upper German]] writers. Compare {{m|de|entgegen}}, which still takes dative. ====Synonyms==== * {{l|de|wider}} ---- ==Middle High German== ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|gmh|gagen}} * {{l|gmh|jegen}} * {{l|gmh|gein}}, {{l|gmh|gēn}} {{qual|contractions}} ===Etymology=== From {{der|gmh|goh|gagan}}, {{der|gmh|goh|gagen}}, {{der|gmh|goh|gegin}}. ===Preposition=== {{head|gmh|preposition}} {{lb|de|+ dative, sometimes + accusative}} # [[against]]
